posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Arcane Dagger-Master

Image source: http://blackmarches.wdfiles.com/local-- ... dus/Caddus

This was a cool concept I came up with.

Dex Halfling Wizard / Rogue, with all the good stuff:
- Level 9 'undispellable' wizard spell book with Extend, Empower, Craft Wand, Scribe Scroll
- Epic Warding / Epic Mage Armor
- Base melee AB 38 and ranged AB 36 (despite a BAB of 23), 7d6 sneak attack with Improved Knockdown
- 300+ skill points to max stealth, detect, concentration, disable trap, Tumble 40 / UMD 30, set deadly traps
- Evasion/Improved Evasion, Uncanny Dodge, Epic Dodge (eventually)
- 350+ hp (with 39 hit die of d4 and d6, not bad at all), top it off with an empowered endurance and you should be able to front line ok (I think), not dwarven defender style, but enough

Plus an ending topping of Ranger Cheese for free dual wielding (by which time he should have the AB to use this properly), free bonus epic feat for epic prowess, and the ability to further skill dump stealth and detect.

Heaps of ways he can utilise his sneak attack, with summons, with a sling, with stealth, with traps, with improved knockdown, with invisibility, and of course, our favorite spell, Bigby's.

With extended haste he can start off sneaks with a two hit flurry, then stealth away.

Chose school of illusion for the extra spells / day. Essentially no multiclass penalties (only at level 40 when the ranger level is taken).

And of course its a halfling, one of the coolest races in the game! 

Only one sort of similar build in the archives (Shadow of Magic Wizard 26/Rogue 13/SD 1), here I've decided the costs of SD are too much with the pre-requisite feats, and chose to use ranger instead for the bonus feat, I also like builds with str 10+ due to encumbrance.

Anyway this one looked nice so I thought I would put this one up for review, maybe there is stuff you guys would do differently, love to hear it.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for the suggested tweaks!
@webshaman1 - for kukris you can swap toughness for exotic weapon proficiency, then the weapon foci to kukri's if you wish. Will cost 40hp in exchange for a wider crit range (which can be buffed with Keen Edge). Not a bad trade, I personally wanted a little more HP, but with empowered Endurance + Summons to tank for you, one could do fine. 

Thanks for the tip on Belkar Bitterleaf, what an interesting character! Halfling Rogue/Barbarian with a +20 ring of jumping. 

@conlaoch - for int 20, you can drop starting cons to 14, starting dex to 14 and increase starting int to 18 for +43 skill points at the cost of -1AB/-1AC/-1fort/-40hp, plus you can trade one great intelligence feat at level 27 for an epic skill focus: concentration or disable trap, epic energy resistance or armor skin. Bit expensive, but probably ok with Base AB 37 given the buffs in the build.

My WoG account is currently like a conveyor belt with all the build drafts I am trying to churn through btw to play test. @BlackCobra tells me if he sees a new toon on the server, he'll just assume its me and /tp Orion "Another Toon???" :)

@Mick Dagger - Agree with you on Daggers there. Underrated weapon. I wanted to build more with such a weapon. No real bias I can see.

I think I would want to take a leaf out of Grizzled_Dwarflord's book here on casters, and take Epic Skill Focus: Concentration, for a bit of crazy casting in the middle of combat. 

A very nice tweak to trade that -1AB/-1AC/-1 reflex/-1 stealth for the skill points and a few more spells. 


Edit: also on that note. 

Without changing the ending attribute scores of the original build design, I realised if I increase Int instead of Dex at level 20 and swap the great int feat for great dexterity at 27 I increase total skill points from 326 -> 331. 

I'll edit it in when I get a chance. Appreciate your thoughts Empyre

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
As an option for the INT/DEX split, an INT+1 could be taken at level 20 (instead of DEX+1) and take Great Dexterity at level 27 (Sorc 15) as a general feat. This would garner an additional 5 skill points without delaying Epic Dodge nor changing starting point distribution.

If one desired MORE skill points, I would drop starting CON to 14, take INT 17, and STR 11 (for carry). Then, take INT+1 at level 4, and swap the level 27 Great Intelligence feat for a Great Dexterity. It will slightly delay the AB progression, but catches up at level 27. It trades 40 HP for 36 skill points and 8 lbs carry.

On another note, I like the daggers in this build, and would like to add in Empower Spell, but I can't have everything, and don't know that it would be worth trading Toughness for it.
